name: Masala Dosa
description: A South Indian classic: a crispy, golden rice and lentil crepe filled with a savory spiced potato masala. Served hot with coconut chutney and tangy sambar, it's a breakfast favorite across India.

name: Idli
description: Soft, fluffy steamed rice cakes made from fermented rice and lentil batter. Idlis are light, healthy, and typically served with sambar and coconut chutney for a wholesome breakfast.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
description: A regal rice dish from Hyderabad, featuring fragrant basmati rice layered with marinated meat, caramelized onions, and aromatic spices. Slow-cooked to perfection, it's a celebration on a plate.

name: Haleem
description: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with wheat, lentils, and tender meat, flavored with aromatic spices and ghee. Traditionally enjoyed during Ramadan, it's hearty, creamy, and deeply satisfying.

name: Mirchi Bajji
description: A spicy street snack: large green chilies stuffed, dipped in gram flour batter, and deep-fried until golden. Crispy outside, soft and fiery insideâ€”perfect with a cup of chai.

name: Double Ka Meetha
description: A rich Hyderabadi dessert made from fried bread slices soaked in saffron- and cardamom-infused milk, topped with ghee and dry fruits. It's a festive treat, especially during weddings.

name: Qubani Ka Meetha
description: A traditional Hyderabadi dessert made from dried apricots stewed in sugar syrup, garnished with cream and nuts. It's luscious, tangy, and a must-have at Hyderabadi feasts.

name: Irani Chai
description: A creamy, aromatic tea brewed with milk and cardamom, Irani Chai is a staple in Hyderabad's old-world cafes. Served in small cups, it's perfect for a relaxing break.

name: Keema Samosa
description: A savory snack: crisp pastry pockets filled with spiced minced meat, onions, and herbs. Deep-fried until golden, they're a popular treat during Ramadan and festive occasions.

name: Malai Kulfi
description: A traditional Indian frozen dessert made from thickened milk, sugar, and nuts. Creamy, dense, and flavored with cardamom and saffron, it's the perfect summer treat.

name: Hyderabadi Dum Ka Murgh
description: A rich, creamy chicken curry with a hint of tamarind. The chicken is cooked until tender and the sauce is thick and flavorful.

name: Khatti Dal
description: A tangy and hearty lentil preparation featuring toor dal cooked with tamarind, onions, and aromatic spices. The perfect balance of sour and savory flavors makes it a comforting accompaniment to rice or roti.

name: Lukhmi
description: A Hyderabadi specialty: square-shaped pastries filled with spiced minced meat, onions, and herbs. These flaky, savory treats are larger than samosas and make perfect appetizers or tea-time snacks.

name: Sheer Khurma
description: A luxurious Eid delicacy made with dates, vermicelli, and milk, enriched with nuts and aromatic cardamom. This creamy dessert is garnished with dried fruits and served warm or chilled during festive celebrations.

name: Pathar Ka Gosht
description: A unique Hyderabadi delicacy where marinated meat is cooked on a heated stone slab, infusing it with a distinctive smoky flavor. The meat is tenderized with papaya and seasoned with special spices for a truly memorable dish.

name: Hyderabadi Baingan
description: Tender eggplants cooked in a rich, aromatic gravy with ground spices, peanuts, and sesame seeds. This classic Hyderabadi preparation brings out the best in eggplants with its perfect blend of spices and textures.

name: Khagina
description: A hearty Hyderabadi breakfast dish featuring fluffy scrambled eggs cooked with finely chopped onions, green chilies, and aromatic spices. This protein-rich dish is often served with hot paratha or naan bread.

name: Malai Paya
description: A rich, creamy curry made with tender goat trotters slow-cooked with milk, aromatic spices, and herbs. This luxurious dish is traditionally enjoyed for breakfast and is known for its intense flavor and nutritional value.

name: Hyderabadi Khichdi
description: A comforting one-pot meal of rice and moong dal, cooked with ghee and mild spices. This wholesome dish is garnished with caramelized onions and is perfect for those seeking a light yet satisfying meal.

name: Shahi Tukda
description: A royal dessert made with golden-fried bread slices soaked in cardamom-scented sugar syrup, topped with thickened milk, and garnished with nuts. This indulgent treat is a perfect blend of crispy and creamy textures.

name: Hyderabadi Nihari
description: A robust breakfast stew of slow-cooked meat in a thick, spiced gravy. This royal dish is cooked overnight until the meat is tender and falls off the bone, creating a rich, flavorful curry perfect with hot naan bread.

name: Badam Ki Jali
description: An intricate Hyderabadi sweet made with ground almonds, sugar, and cardamom, crafted into a delicate lattice pattern. This royal dessert is infused with saffron and requires great skill to prepare its signature net-like appearance.

name: Hyderabadi Kheema
description: A flavorful preparation of minced meat cooked with aromatic spices, onions, and tomatoes. This versatile dish can be enjoyed with rice, roti, or as a filling for various breads and is a staple in Hyderabadi cuisine.

name: Doodh Ka Sherbet
description: A refreshing milk-based beverage enriched with nuts, cardamom, and rose water. This cooling drink is often served during summer months and special occasions, garnished with chopped nuts and a touch of saffron.

name: Hyderabadi Korma
description: A luxurious curry made with tender meat pieces cooked in a rich gravy of yogurt, ground nuts, and aromatic spices. This mild yet flavorful dish is a perfect example of Hyderabadi's Nawabi cuisine.

name: Khubani Ka Sharbat
description: A refreshing summer drink made with fresh apricots, mint leaves, and a hint of lemon. This sweet and tangy beverage is known for its cooling properties and is often served during hot summer days in Hyderabad.

name: Hyderabadi Baingan Ka Salan
description: A classic Hyderabadi curry where baby eggplants are simmered in a rich, nutty gravy made with peanuts, sesame seeds, and coconut. This dish is a perfect accompaniment to biryani and is known for its complex flavors.

name: Badam Ki Kheer
description: A luxurious dessert made with ground almonds cooked in creamy milk, flavored with cardamom and saffron. This royal sweet dish is garnished with slivered almonds and is often served during special occasions.

name: Hyderabadi Gosht Ki Biryani
description: A legendary rice dish where tender pieces of mutton are layered with fragrant long-grain rice, aromatic spices, and fresh herbs. This royal preparation is slow-cooked in the dum style, allowing the flavors to meld perfectly.

name: Falooda
description: A grand dessert drink layered with rose-flavored milk, vermicelli, basil seeds, and topped with ice cream. This cooling dessert is garnished with nuts and is perfect for hot summer days or festive celebrations.

name: Hyderabadi Dum Ka Murgh
description: A rich chicken curry where marinated pieces are slow-cooked with yogurt, brown onions, and aromatic spices in the dum style. This royal dish is known for its tender meat and thick, flavorful gravy.

name: Hyderabadi Chai
description: A unique blend of tea brewed with milk, cardamom, and fresh ginger. This aromatic chai is known for its strong flavor and is an integral part of Hyderabadi culture, often enjoyed with local snacks and conversations.
